DOC.brief_summary: This study design evaluate safety autologous muscle fiber fragment treatment urinary incontinence due incompetent outlet ( bladder neck/urethra ) .
DOC.brief_title: Muscle Fiber Fragment Treatment Urinary Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: Eligible subject diagnosis urinary incontinence give consent take part undergo biopsy muscle inner thigh anesthesia . During procedure , muscle fiber fragment obtain sample immediately deliver via target inject bladder neck sphincter region use endoscopic needle via cystoscope ultrasound guidance . All subject follow 1 week , 6 week , 3 month , 6 month 12 month post-treatment injection .
DOC.criteria: Adult female patient pregnant lactating/breastfeeding must either sexually active , surgically sterilize , must practice effective method birth control determine investigator Patients age 18 75 year Patients positive diagnosis urinary incontinence due sphincter insufficiency cause acquire ( e.g. , stress urinary incontinence ) and/or congenital condition . Patients cystometric capacity bladder > 100 ml Patients normal renal function Patients history primary incontinence Patients history hypercontractile bladder , noncompliant bladder , hydronephrosis neurogenic bladder Patients active urinary tract infection evidence positive urine culture Patients take medication affect urination prescription drug , overthecounter drug , dietary supplement , include herbal supplement take teas Patients require concomitant use treatment immunosuppressive agent Patients history systemic condition , include limited HIV , diabetes chronic liver disease ( include Hepatitis B C ) , Investigator believe may jeopardize safety patient participate study Patients evidence diagnosis primary muscle disease coagulation disorder ( include concomitant anticoagulation therapy ) Patients treated investigational drug participate investigational study within 30 day prior enrollment study Patients treat cellular therapy within 12 month prior enrollment study Patients urinary incontinence category investigate Patients significant ( > grade 2 ) pelvic organ prolapse Patients vaginal prolapse beyond introitus Patients neurological disorder Patients abnormal bladder capacity ( i.e. , less 100 cc ) Patients abnormal urologic condition , include postvoid residual , urethral stricture bladder neck contracture , spastic bladder , vesicoureteral reflux , bladder stone , bladder tumor , hydronephrosis , renal impairment
